meanings.sent1: The sneaky raccoon managed to outthieve the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The thief tried to outthieve his partner by stealing more valuable items.
meanings.sent3: It was a competition to see who could outthieve the clever fox in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The pickpocket was known to outthieve even the most experienced thieves in the city.
meanings.sent5: The magician's ability to outthieve the audience's attention was truly remarkable.

meanings.sent1: The notorious criminal planned to outthieve all the other robbers in town.
meanings.sent2: The master thief knew how to outthieve any security system put in place.
meanings.sent3: The competition was fierce as each thief tried to outthieve the others in the heist.
meanings.sent4: The cat burglar managed to outthieve the police by always staying one step ahead.
meanings.sent5: The art of outthieving requires skill, precision, and a touch of luck.
